snippet: Rajavarothiam Sampanthan, 82, becomes the first member of the island nation’s largest minority to hold the post in more than three decades.
abstract: Sri Lanka's Parliament names ethnic minority Tamil lawmaker Rajavarothiam Sampanthan as opposition leader for first time in more than 30 years.

byline.contributor: Nida Najar contributed reporting from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Rajavarothiam Sampanthan, 82, becomes the first member of the island nation’s largest minority to hold the post in more than three decades.

headline.main: Tamil Lawmaker to Lead Opposition in Sri Lanka
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Sri Lanka: Tamil Will Lead Opposition
